result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany M. Marvin

records.addlTxt:
1:52 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin in court, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Christopher Restemayer in court for Brittany M. Marvin.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Atty Restmayer has copy of informaiton, and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea. State advise def is awaiting revocation. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:15 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Brittany M. Marvin. All parties via zoom. Atty Zich wants to continue with p.h.  Def. wants to continue with hearing via zoom.  Court will allow. Deputy Josue Rojas, Langlade County Sheriff Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Evidence closed. Court finds probable cause and binds over.  State would like 30 days to file information.  Atty Zich heard hearing is set past 30 days. State heard on burden when filing an information. Atty Zich makes record. Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:34 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Brittany M. Marvin.  All parties via zoom.  Atty Zich has copy of compliant, waives reading and request timely p.h.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substance. 
No contact with co defendant Steven Bembenek

1:16PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. is on probation hold. ADA will be in touch with probation agent. Def. makes statement on bond. Court orders $2,000 cash bond bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with co defendant Steven Bembenek. Def. makes statement and enters plea of Not Guilty of charges. Court advise def. to contact P.D.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
